title: Cadillac set to announce Sergio Perez as F1 driver for 2026
content: Sergio Perez’s Formula 1 return with newcomer Cadillac in 2026 on a multi-year deal is expected to be announced, Motorsport.com has learned. Following several months of negotiations, Motorsport.com understands Perez and Cadillac have finalised their talks, with an announcement coming later this week.One key point of discussion was the length of the 35-year-old’s contract and it is ...Keep reading

title: Everything we’re excited for in the second half of F1's 2025 season
content: Formula 1 returns from its traditional summer break this weekend at Zandvoort for the Dutch Grand Prix with drivers and teams recharged and ready for the final 10 rounds of 2025.McLaren duo Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris are clear in the fight for the drivers' title and will be hard to overcome if past races are anything to go by, though Max Verstappen will be hungry to give his adoring home ...Keep reading

title: Why Toyota’s deal with Haas may have come too late for its 2026 F1 shift
content: Last October, Haas and Toyota announced a partnership in which they would “Share Knowledge and Resources for Mutual Benefit”. A generous portion of corporate word salad, but lacking in substantive detail. It soon became clear that one of the new partnership’s priorities was to develop a new driver-in-loop simulator, a critical piece of infrastructure Haas currently lacks. Not only do these ...Keep reading

title: 'We don't want a chess game' - FIA responds to claims F1’s 2026 cars are too complex
content: The sweeping overhaul of Formula 1’s regulations for 2026 presents a challenge for all teams and engine manufacturers, but that also applies to the drivers.Charles Leclerc has said the new cars feel “very different” based on his first simulator runs, while Alex Albon added that F1 becomes far more complex. Drivers will have to manage more, prompting Williams team boss James Vowles to ...Keep reading

title: The one area where McLaren was "genuinely struggling" in F1 pre-season testing
content: While McLaren's baseline form over the early part of the 2025 Formula 1 season had been strong, any weaknesses that emerged in the year's nascent stages appear to have been ironed out with development.The team has secured 1-2 finishes in each of the last four races, putting it 299 points clear of Ferrari in the constructors' championship with 10 rounds remaining. If it continues that form, it ...Keep reading

title: Esteban Ocon reckons Haas F1 team is ‘healthier’ than Alpine – here’s why
content: “We haven't always been listened to. And this is why some of the issues still remain after five years in this team."This is how Esteban Ocon assessed his time within the Alpine squad right before Formula 1’s 2024 summer break, which came before he had even departed the Enstone-based outfit.At the time, Ocon had just signed with Haas for 2025; he was already pledging to create a ...Keep reading

title: Andrea Kimi Antonelli is better than his F1 results show, says George Russell
content: George Russell is leading his team-mate Andrea Kimi Antonelli in Formula 1’s points standings, qualifying results, and he is the only Mercedes driver to take a race win so far this season. However, the Brit says these stats don’t paint the full picture of Antonelli’s start in F1. The Italian rookie filled the gap left by Ferrari-bound Lewis Hamilton at Mercedes this year after a ...Keep reading

title: How F1 teams pick their drivers and what Cadillac’s rumoured Valtteri Bottas signing means
content: As reported by Motorsport.com in June, Valtteri Bottas is primed to agree terms with Cadillac to complete his return to a Formula 1 race seat. This leaves just one much-coveted seat as the grid expands to 22 cars, and everyone without a contract next year has been linked to it.Of them, Sergio Perez is considered the most likely and most attractive candidate to the team, given his experience ...Keep reading

title: Why “hooligan” Oliver Bearman is Esteban Ocon’s “best” team-mate
content: When Esteban Ocon signed with Haas a year ago, he was looking for a healthier working environment than the one he left behind at Alpine. Halfway through 2025, he believes the move is paying off – both in terms of results and the atmosphere inside the team.Having previously endured turbulent relationships with team-mates such as Pierre Gasly at Alpine and Sergio Perez at Force India, Ocon ...Keep reading

title: Five failed Formula 1 entries that never made it to the grid

title: These Formula 1 records may never be broken
content: Formula 1 fans watched with tears in their eyes as Nico Hulkenberg finally picked up his first podium at the British Grand Prix earlier this year, ending a streak that saw him start almost 240 F1 races before stepping onto his first rostrum.That impressive milestone means Hulkenberg no longer holds the, rather unfortunate, record for the most race starts without making the podium - an unwanted ...Keep reading

title: How Carlos Sainz’s arrival pushed Alex Albon and Williams forward in F1 2025

title: "Very cool": Oscar Piastri reacts to Alain Prost’s Goodwood praise
content: Alain Prost spoke of his admiration for Formula 1 championship leader Oscar Piastri during this year's Goodwood Festival of Speed, and the Australian says it was "very cool" for a four-time champion to be so effusive in his praise.Prost and Piastri previously worked together at Alpine, where the Frenchman was an advisor and non-executive director, while Piastri was part of the team's junior ...Keep reading

title: Sauber won't give up on 2025 despite impending Audi switch and F1 overhaul
content: Up and down the F1 pitlane, the finest engineering minds are fully focused on solving the challenges of the forthcoming shift to an entirely new car and drivetrain package for 2026. Given McLaren’s dominance so far this year, many could be forgiven for declaring this a “stop the count” moment and disregarding the 10 remaining rounds of 2025 entirely. That’s not how Sauber plans to ...Keep reading

title: Liam Lawson’s fight to stay in F1 isn’t over: "Three good races aren’t enough"
content: "He's not being demoted — he's moving to Racing Bulls, which has a very competitive car, much easier to handle than the RB21," Helmut Marko told Motorsport.com in early spring, after Red Bull decided to replace Liam Lawson with Yuki Tsunoda in its main squad. Marko was adamant this was not the end of the road for the New Zealander."The change happened after a start that I’d say was rather ...Keep reading

title: Chip Ganassi shuts down Alex Palou and Red Bull F1 rumors as "clickbait"
content: Earlier this week, reports emerged about Red Bull Racing showing a possible interest in recruiting Alex Palou to drive for the team in Formula 1.However, in a Tuesday media availability, team owner Chip Ganassi asserted that these rumors surrounding his star driver are false."I read that myself, and there was nobody quoted in there," said Ganassi, answering a question from AP's Jenna ...Keep reading

title: Sergio Perez: "I have nothing to prove" with Cadillac after Red Bull F1 exit
content: Sergio Perez says the struggles of his Red Bull replacements show that he has nothing to prove on his Formula 1 return with Cadillac.On Tuesday, Perez and fellow F1 veteran and multiple race winner Valtteri Bottas were presented as the experience pair that will lead Cadillac's charge in 2026 as F1's 11th team. title: “We don’t need to take silly risks” – How Williams changed the way it goes racing
content: “Very confident” – that’s the way Williams racer Alex Albon described his fourth Formula 1 season with the team at the halfway point. The ex-Red Bull driver has already amassed more points in 2025 than in his last three years with the Grove-based team combined – and this, he says, is changing the way Williams goes racing. title: What’s on at the 2025 Dutch Grand Prix
content: Discover the full 2025 Dutch Grand Prix experience at Circuit Zandvoort. Explore the race schedule, F1 Fanzone activities, live music, and driver appearances from 29–31 August.

title: How Cadillac’s chiefs ‘pressure-tested’ Bottas and Perez
content: Cadillac's driver line-up has been the talk of the town for months, and while the incoming American squad have kept public chatter to a minimum, behind the scenes, they've gone through a painstakingly detailed process to selected their first-ever race drivers.

title: Why Cadillac decided to go for Perez and Bottas
content: Cadillac have gone for experience for their debut season in Formula 1, with the American outfit signing race winners Sergio Perez and Valtteri Bottas. F1 Correspondent Lawrence Barretto explains more...

title: Perez and Bottas to make F1 returns in 2026 with Cadillac
content: Cadillac have signed Grand Prix winners Sergio Perez and Valtteri Bottas to be their drivers when they join the Formula 1 grid for the first time in 2026.

title: Stella wary of Ferrari threat over second half of season
content: Andrea Stella reckons McLaren will face more of a test from their rivals across the final 10 rounds of the 2025 Formula 1 campaign, and Ferrari in particular, following his team’s imperious run in the opening half of the year.

title: Wheatley explains what he can bring from Red Bull to Kick Sauber/Audi
content: Jonathan Wheatley has shared what he has been able to carry forward from his time with Red Bull through to his new role as Team Principal at Kick Sauber, with the Briton having “immersed” himself in the Hinwil-based outfit since joining back in April.

title: 5 storylines we're excited about at the Dutch GP
content: Three weeks on from the last race weekend in Budapest, it’s race week again as the 2025 season gets set to resume. The teams have all had to commit to a two-week shutdown during August, but should be raring to go when the paddock reconvenes at Zandvoort.

title: How Ferrari’s 2025 season has played out so far
content: It has been another headline-filled season for Ferrari, with seven-time World Champion Lewis Hamilton arriving, scrutiny over a planned title bid that did not materialise, and team boss Fred Vasseur subsequently having to navigate a barrage of speculation about his future. So, where do the legendary team stand at the summer break? Here is their half term report…

title: 10 of the best F1 bromances from over the years
content: We’ve been taking a look back at some of F1’s best ‘bromances’ from across the years, ranging from the sport’s early days through to the duos that have formed bonds during the modern era.

title: Piastri on becoming a title contender and battling Norris
content: In just his third F1 season, McLaren's Oscar Piastri is a firm title contender as he leads the Drivers' Championship ahead of his team mate Lando Norris. With just 10 race weekends left in 2025, the Australian looks back on his year so far and what's to come.
